name: Ten Days In May Quiz | Famous Dates | 10 Questions

questions.text: Leonardo da Vinci died on May 2, 1519. Where did he die?
questions.explanation:
Cloux, France.

	Leonardo was the son of a wealthy Florentine notary and a peasant woman. He spent his last days working for King Francis I of France at the Chateau de Cloux, near Amboise.

questions.text: This 'man of stars' died on May 24, 1543. Who was he?
questions.explanation:
Copernicus.

	Copernicus moved to Frauenberg in 1512, where he died.

questions.text: On May 20, 1588, the Spanish Armada set out, intent on the invasion of England. Where did the Armada sail from?
questions.explanation:
Lisbon.

	Philip II of Spain conquered Portugal in 1580. Spain's occupation of Portugal lasted until 1640, so at the time of the Armada, Spain used Lisbon as one of its main ports.

questions.text: Karl Marx was born on May 5, 1818 in Prussia. Who did Marx collaborate with to produce 'The Communist Manifesto'?
questions.explanation:
Friedrich Engels.

	Marx was a revolutionary, sociologist, historian and economist. 'The Communist Manifesto' became the most celebrated pamphlet in the history of the socialist movement.

questions.text: What event took place on May 13, 1917, that has affected millions throughout the Roman Catholic world?
questions.correct: The Virgin Mary appeared in Fatima, Portugal
options: Pope Benedict XIV is killed on a World War I battlefield
Pope John Paul II is born in Poland
The statue of Jesus Christ 'The King' is unveiled in Rio de Janeiro
questions.explanation:
The Virgin Mary appeared in Fatima, Portugal.

	Three little shepherd children saw the apparitions. Francisco, his younger sister Jacinta and cousin Lucia, their experiences led to the formation of a place of pilgrimage, visited by millions.

questions.text: The German Airship, the Hindenburg crashed while attempting a mooring, on May 6, 1937. Where did this disaster take place?
questions.explanation:
Lakehurst, New Jersey.

	The great zeppelin exploded causing heavy loss of life.

questions.text: A much more positive aeronautical first, took place on May 20 and 21, 1927. What was it?
questions.correct: Charles Lindbergh flies solo across the Atlantic
options: Amelia Earhardt flies non stop from Florida to Alaska
Calvin Coolidge becomes the first president to fly to a foreign country
James C. Angel discovers the Highest uninterrupted cataract in the world
questions.explanation:
Charles Lindbergh flies solo across the Atlantic.

	Lucky Lindy took 33 hours and 32 minutes to complete his historical flight. He landed at Bourget Airport near Paris on May 21, 1927.

questions.text: Why is May 8, 1945 a special day?
questions.correct: It was V.E. Day, victory in Europe
options: It was the day that the Nuremberg War Trials started
Mussolini was arrested and Hitler commited suicide
questions.explanation:
It was V.E. Day, victory in Europe

	The British and U.S. governments declared May 8 as V.E. Day. The full unconditional surrender took place at one minute past midnight.

questions.text: Which State was formed on May 14, 1948?
questions.explanation:
Israel.

	When the British mandate over Palestine expired, the state of Israel was formed with David Ben Gurion as the first prime minister.

questions.text: What immovable object finally succumbed to the proverbial irresistable force on May 29, 1953?
questions.correct: The summit of Mount Everest was reached for the first time
options: The coronation ceremony of the Queen of England was filmed for the first time
The Vatican allowed television cameras for the first time
The Church of England discussed women priests for the first time
questions.explanation:
The summit of Mount Everest was reached for the first time.

	Edmund Percival Hillary and Tenzing Norgay were the first to reach the summit.
